channel.title: [PI] NpcHandler [PI]
channel.description: nothing drops bones... the biggest problem is the dragons.. im pretty sure its in npchandler but im not sure how to fix it could anyone help?

item.title: [PI] NpcHandler [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“rhys132, post:7, topic:426229”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=528919.msg3858450#msg3858450 date=1324511572]

Handled in NPCHandler.

Bones are a constant drop in a switch statement that lies in that class. I’m not sure of the name.

Which is a terrible way of doing it by the way. Yet another reason why PI is terrible.
[/quote]
your terrible[/quote]

Lol? Why did you de-rep me? I honestly don’t care, but I didn’t give any “negative comment”.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] NpcHandler [PI]
item.dc:creator: @rhys132 rhys132
item.description:
@rhys132 wrote:

infallibl3:

nothing drops bones… the biggest problem is the dragons… im pretty sure its in npchandler but im not sure how to fix it could anyone help?

npcconstants.cfg or .tsm

put the npc id and then the id of the items that you want to drop every time

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] NpcHandler [PI]
item.dc:creator: @rrooaarr rrooaarr
item.description:
@rrooaarr wrote:

npcdrops.tsm
review a tutorial they tell u how to set it up.

#npc
npc id:percent drops (tab) item id:item ammount
constants are on this line, such as bones same as the drop setup from top except dont restate npc id

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] NpcHandler [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

NPCDrops.CFG

I don’t even use PI, but It’s probably in that. If not, then check in your Classes involving NPCs. It might look something like this:

public static int Gargoyle[] = {1311,1353};

public static int RandomGargoyle() {
	return Gargoyle[(int)(Math.random()*Gargoyle.length)];
}

Read full topic
